Articles.Content:
Due to ObsessedWithKSP being busy, I am providing the Squadcast Summary this week and will try to continue to do so until OWK can return.

KasperVld Hosting - Started really early at 1:00pm CDT (18:00 UTC)

Note: The below information has been summarized and should not be taken as direct quotes from Squad.

Discussion Highlights:

- PS4 Version being worked on by FlyingTiger (contract developer) but KasperVld cannot discuss it further. They are very excited to go to PS4 to open the ability for more gamers to learn about rocket science.
- Memory Leak in Temperature Gauges being looked at.
- KSP 25% off for a limited time on GoG, Humble, and Steam! (Demo on Steam)
- KasperVld likes the "confetti" fairing.
- Working on 1.0.3 - Kasper can't comment on changes made.
- Multiplayer is in development and is very complex. No details yet.
- Why doesn't the KSP Gamers Edition have Valentina?: Stay tuned for information on that, no confirmation but Squad might be working on something.
- A lot of discussion on best possible ways to implement time warp in Multiplayer.
- OSX 10.10? changes the memory management and has issues with Unity 4. Unknown if Unity 5 will fix it.
- **Announcement: 1.0.3 Due for release next week. Maybe a bit late, but it is looking very good for next week barring any major issues.**
- If a meteor hits Squad headquarters, there is currently no plan to rescue development resources from the fallout.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T19:01:52Z" title="06/19/2015 07:01  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Alshain**

So, the memory leak is not necessarily being addressed by 1.0.3; which cannot be discussed? 

Ok then.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T19:17:30Z" title="06/19/2015 07:17  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Randazzo**

> 
> So, the memory leak is not necessarily being addressed by 1.0.3, which cannot be discussed? 
> Ok then.

He didn't say it wouldn't be fixed in 1.0.3, he just didn't know for sure and couldn't comment. Remember, KasperVld is the community manager, he isn't a developer or the producer. Because of this he doesn't have quite as in-depth knowledge of the little details for each patch. He was being very cautious not to give false information, it's better to say he can't comment than promise something that doesn't show up.

I hope that the "meteor" isn't PS4 shaped.

/cynicism

I thought the temperature gauge memory leak was already fixed. Are you simply saying that they are testing it to make sure no other bugs appeared from the fix?

Edit: ninja'd.

> 
> Memory Leak in Temperature Gauges being looked at.

That is *the* single reason we have been waiting for 1.0.3.

I understand that Kasper is not a dev/producer, thats cool, whatever. But since we got no real devnotes, can we expect that an actual dev will comment in this thread to confirm the memory leak is being fixed?

please.

> 
> I hope that the "meteor" isn't PS4 shaped.
> /cynicism

Lol, priceless.

Seems like slow but good news. I wasn't expecting MP to be seriously being worked on at this point.

Thanks Alshain! Happy to learn Kasper was able to host SQ, after all. Good info to take us through the weekend. PS4 concerns seem to be quieting down, now that most forum-goers have learned about it, and have asked their questions (even if they don't fully like the answers.)

> 
> I wasn't expecting MP to be seriously being worked on at this point.

I recall one of the devnotes saying that HarvestR is going to put Mu as lead at some point so that he can focus all his attention on Multiplayer. I can't really remember the details. but that was a thing.

> 
> - KasperVld likes the "confetti" fairing.

Okay, so maybe they should keep it as an option, say, a tweakable button. But there should also be a clamshell option, preferably default. We have tweakables now, so we should use them.

seconded. Confetti fairings are uncool, but a tweakable is fair.

I was under the impression that besides a switch to unity 5 that the memory leaks were going to be addressed. I mean the fact that they acknowledged the leaks is promising, however what would be the point of coming out with an update that doesn't address some of the biggest problems in KSP. Yea we upgraded to U5 but a still have game crashing problems. What I am saying is that since the acknowledged it, they probably have a fix for it. Otherwise they would have continued to ignore the problems so I am optimistic they will have fixes in the next update.

I can't get away with not crashing for one mission to and from, but its like Russian roulette the second time. Its gonna crash you just dont know when. Most likely right as you begin reentry after a mission.

I don't know what to believe or expect anymore as an OS X user.

Not sure there is an adequate OS X test resource in place... Not sure if anyone actually understands the OS X problem to a sufficient level of detail... 

One thing I sadly believe is that 1.0.3 will likely NOT address the core of OS X reliability issues. Having monitored the bug tracker over that past year, I'm convinced it's just a joke - as it never seems to be maintained properly.

No roadmap, no control over bug tracking... Go figure.

Still, I love the game and have a lot of time for Squad, but come on guys, get your "Shed" together!
